result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Nicholas J Stanisch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

09-17-2014 The Court orders the defendant reimburse Jefferson County for Court appointed attorney fees in the amount of $936.46

**Pursuant to the Court of Appeal decision in State v. Edward, 2015 WI 51, 363 Wis.2d 628 and State v. Radaj, 2015 WI 50, 363 Wis.2d 633, and 973.13, Stats., the JOC is amended to remove the DNA surcharge(s).  Government entities shall, to the extent legally obligated to do so, comply with the courts Order to Amend Judgment of Conviction Re: DNA Surcharge(s) entered herein.**

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to submit to random urinalyses, to occur at least once per month for the first six months of the Probation term
--no possession or controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as approved by the Agent, and except for incidental contact for employment or educational programming as approved by the Agent 
--to obtain/maintain fulltime employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent

Arresting Agency:  JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 9:05am. 
Defendant Nicholas J Stanisch in court with Attorney Steven C. Spear.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On Motion of the State, the Court amends Count #3 to an Unclassified Misdeanor Possession of THC contrary to Statute 961.41(3g)(e).

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; pleas of " No Contest " entered on Counts #2 & #3; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Stanisch guilty. 

As to Count #2, the Court does not enter Judgment; the Court approves the Deferred Prosecution Agreement, signing it as its Order.  The DPA will terminate on August 22nd, 2015. 
As to Count #3, the Court orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count # 1.

On Count #3, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Stanisch on Probation for one year, with conditions:
--to serve 30 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on September 12, 2014 at 7:00pm.
---Mr. Stanisch is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to submit to random urinalyses, to occur at least once per month for the first six months of the Probation term
--no possession or controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as approved by the Agent, and except for incidental contact for employment or educational programming as approved by the Agent 
--to obtain/maintain fulltime employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to reimburse Jefferson County for court-appointed attorney fees 
--to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay the $75 drug testing fee and $210 drug-buy money reimbursement 


Days credit for time already served:  0 days

As to #14CV 212 the Court receives the stipulation of the parties that Mr. Stanisch is agreeing to the forfeiture of the vehicle.  The State will submit a proposed order for forfeiture of the vehicle to the assigned judge, Judge Hue. 

The Court will not allow for expungement of the Count #3 conviction in this case. 
recess 9:25am.
Criminal Case Settlement & Proposed Deferred Prosecution Agreement, with cover letter
Plea hearing on August 22, 2014 at 09:00 am.

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 9:49am.
Defendant Nicholas J Stanisch in court with Attorney Steven C. Spear.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Spear indicates that the parties have reached an agreement; there is a signed Criminal Case Settlement form which includes a deferred prosecution agreement. 
Attorney Spear requests that a hearing be scheduled in the next couple of weeks. 
Mr. Stanisch indicates that the CTH Z address remains current.
recess 9:50am.

NEXT:  schedule Plea Hearing in approximately two weeks
FINANCIAL NOTES: $75.00 attorney fee paid via gps
Order appointing counsel endorsed by Attorney Spear w/cover letter
Status conference on August 8, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 16, 2014 at 10:20 am.
States demand w/cover letter
[MK]

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 8:47am. 
Defendant Nicholas J Stanisch in court with Attorney Steven C Spear.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Stanisch waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered  

The Court reminds Mr. Stanisch of his obligation to make $75 per month payments toward court-appointed attorney fees. The Court provides Mr. Stanisch with a copy of the Order Appointing Counsel that shows this information. 
Mr. Stanisch verifies that the CTH Z address remains current. 
recess 8:51am. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 7/16/14 at 10:20  (2) schedule Status Conference approximately 2-3 weeks after the Pretrial date
* FINANCIAL RECORDS *
The Court appoints Attorney Spear//repayment order of $75 a month starting 08-01-2014
with attached State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility (Defendant not eligible)
